class abcmodel.land_surface.AquaCropModel(c3c4, **kwargs)[source]#

AquaCrop land surface model with coupled photosynthesis and stomatal conductance.

A bit more advanced land surface model implementing the AquaCrop approach with coupled photosynthesis-stomatal conductance calculations. Includes detailed biochemical processes for both C3 and C4 vegetation types, soil moisture stress effects, and explicit CO2 flux calculations.

Processes#

  1. Inherit all standard land surface processes from parent class.

  2. Calculate CO2 compensation concentration based on temperature.

  3. Compute mesophyll conductance with temperature response functions.

  4. Determine internal CO2 concentration using stomatal optimization.

  5. Calculate gross primary productivity with light and moisture limitations.

  6. Scale from leaf-level to canopy-level fluxes using extinction functions.

  7. Compute surface resistance from canopy conductance.

  8. Calculate net CO2 fluxes including plant assimilation and soil respiration.

param - all arguments from StandardLandSurfaceParams.:

param - c3c4:

type - c3c4:

plant type, either “c3” or “c4”.

param - co2comp298:

type - co2comp298:

CO2 compensation concentration [mg m-3].

param - net_rad10CO2:

type - net_rad10CO2:

function parameter to calculate CO2 compensation concentration [-].

param - gm298:

type - gm298:

mesophyill conductance at 298 K [mm s-1].

param - ammax298:

type - ammax298:

CO2 maximal primary productivity [mg m-2 s-1].

param - net_rad10gm:

type - net_rad10gm:

function parameter to calculate mesophyll conductance [-].

param - temp1gm:

type - temp1gm:

reference temperature to calculate mesophyll conductance gm [K].

param - temp2gm:

type - temp2gm:

reference temperature to calculate mesophyll conductance gm [K].

param - net_rad10Am:

type - net_rad10Am:

function parameter to calculate maximal primary profuctivity Ammax.

param - temp1Am:

type - temp1Am:

reference temperature to calculate maximal primary profuctivity Ammax [K].

param - temp2Am:

type - temp2Am:

reference temperature to calculate maximal primary profuctivity Ammax [K].

param - f0:

type - f0:

maximum value Cfrac [-].

param - ad:

type - ad:

regression coefficient to calculate Cfrac [kPa-1].

param - alpha0:

type - alpha0:

initial low light conditions [mg J-1].

param - kx:

type - kx:

extinction coefficient PAR [-].

param - gmin:

type - gmin:

cuticular (minimum) conductance [mm s-1].

param - nuco2q:

type - nuco2q:

ratio molecular viscosity water to carbon dioxide.

param - cw:

type - cw:

constant water stress correction (eq. 13 Jacobs et al. 2007) [-].

param - wmax:

type - wmax:

upper reference value soil water [-].

param - wmin:

type - wmin:

lower reference value soil water [-].

param - r10:

type - r10:

respiration at 10 C [mg CO2 m-2 s-1].

param - e0:

type - e0:

activation energy [53.3 kJ kmol-1].

class abcmodel.land_surface.JarvisStewartInitConds(alpha, wg, w2, temp_soil, temp2, surf_temp, wl, rs=1000000.0, rssoil=1000000.0, cliq=nan, temp_soil_tend=nan, wgtend=nan, wltend=nan, le_veg=nan, le_liq=nan, le_soil=nan, le=nan, hf=nan, gf=nan, le_pot=nan, le_ref=nan, ra=nan)[source]#

StandardLandSurfaceInitConds. (- all arguments from)

class abcmodel.land_surface.JarvisStewartModel(**kwargs)[source]#

Jarvis-Stewart land surface model with empirical surface resistance.

Implementation of the Jarvis-Stewart approach for calculating surface resistance based on environmental stress factors. Uses multiplicative stress functions for radiation, soil moisture, vapor pressure deficit, and temperature effects on stomatal conductance.

Processes#

  1. Inherit all standard land surface processes from parent class.

  2. Calculate surface resistance using four environmental stress factors.

  3. Apply Jarvis-Stewart multiplicative stress function approach.

  4. No CO2 flux calculations (simple implementation).

Updates#

  • rs: surface resistance for transpiration [s m-1].

  • all updates from AbstractStandardLandSurfaceModel.

compute_co2_flux(state, const)[source]#

Pass.

compute_surface_resistance(state, const)[source]#

Compute surface resistance using Jarvis-Stewart approach.

Parameters:

  • const (-)

  • radiation (-)

  • surface_layer (-)

  • mixed_layer (-)

  • Updates

  • -------

  • (f1) (Updates self.rs using multiplicative stress factors for radiation)

:param : :param soil moisture (f2): :param vapor pressure deficit (f3): :param and temperature (f4).:

get_f1(state)[source]#

Calculate radiation-dependent scaling factor for surface processes.

Returns correction factor based on incoming solar radiation that typically ranges from 1.0 to higher values, used to scale surface flux calculations.

Return type:

Array
